data.question: What is the BET surface area of MFM-102-NO2?
Which MOF has the highest acetylene uptake at 273 K?
Is the stability of MFM-102-NO2 in water higher than its stability in air?
What is the role of −NO2 groups in MFM-102-NO2 according to neutron diffraction and inelastic scattering experiments?
data.answer: They cooperate with open metal sites in the binding of acetylene.

data.question: Does MFM-102-NO2 show a reduction in BET surface area after functionalization with NO2 groups?
What is the Qst value for C2H2 adsorption in MFM-102-NO2?
Can MFM-102-NO2 maintain its structure after being submerged in water for 15 minutes?
What is the effect of amine and alkane groups on acetylene adsorption compared to MFM-102-NO2?
data.answer: Amine groups show a small increase, while alkane groups lead to a moderate reduction in adsorption.

data.question: What is the crystal system of MFM-102-NO2?
Does the introduction of NO2 groups to MFM-102 lead to an improvement in acetylene adsorption?
What is the main method used for the synthesis of H4L3 and H4L4 ligands?
What is the effect of functional groups on the BET surface area of MOFs in the MFM-102 series?
data.answer: Introduction of functional groups leads to a reduction in porosity.

data.question: Is MFM-102-NO2 stable under high vacuum conditions?
What is the main advantage of using MOFs for acetylene storage?
data.answer: Their high porosity and ability to incorporate active binding sites.

data.question: Does the presence of −NO2 groups in MFM-102-NO2 enhance acetylene binding compared to other functional groups?
What is the role of DFT calculations in the study of MFM-102-NO2?
data.answer: They are used to calculate vibrational frequencies and polarization vectors for modeling INS spectra.

data.question: What is the crystallographic space group of MFM-102-NO2?
Is the acetylene uptake of MFM-102-NO2 at 273 K among the best-performing MOFs under the same conditions?
What is the main challenge in storing and transporting acetylene?
data.answer: Its high explosiveness and inability to be compressed beyond 2 atm at room temperature.
